channel.title: Player Location in client?
channel.description:
Where are the getters for the player location in the client?
Dont tell me that im thinking of server side, im thinking client side, the client has to get the playerlocation somewhere.

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Yes, it’s that block right there. It’s the region + the relative position of the region

item.title: Player Location in client?
item.dc:creator: @laakerules laakerules
item.description:
@laakerules wrote:

you sure?

  paramEntity.anInt1520 = -1;
  paramEntity.anInt1547 = 0;
  paramEntity.anInt1548 = 0;
  paramEntity.x = (paramEntity.smallX[0] * 128 + paramEntity.anInt1540 * 64);
  paramEntity.y = (paramEntity.smallY[0] * 128 + paramEntity.anInt1540 * 64);
  paramEntity.method446();

Based off that this is all i can find for the player type stuff. its really gonna be hard to implement my new playerlocation based cycle which runs off of smaller tiles and 20 levels per floor so that stairs and such are on a seperate level and so on.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Location in client?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I don’t believe it has the absolute position in the client. I think what happens is that it takes the region x and y, multiplies it by 64, then adds the number of tiles from the center of the region.

Read full topic
